messageBody:
> > > Hi everybody,
> > > I've written a TestCase for one class.
> > > Is there a way to test another class with this test?
> > > The problem is: it is impossible to pass second one as parameter
to "Test
> > > suite()" method (as it is static and passing will give one result:
> > > last class will be tested twice). Changing test is not really good
> > > (as there will be some more classes that I would like to test with
> > > TestCase).
> >
> > I assume you want to run many tests at one time. The normal way is to
> > create a class that collects the TestCase classes together:
> [...]
>
> No. There idea is:
> public interface IF{
> public static Object calculate(String str,int i);
> }
>
> public class A implements IF{
> //implementation
> }
>
> public class B implements IF{
> //implementation
> }
> //Strategy pattern is used
>
> I know that result will be the same running class A and B. I've made
> test for class A, eg TestA, now I want to test B with this test. The
> problem is: to pass class B to that test and test A and B at one time.

OK. So you want the same tests for each implementation, but you want to write
them once. You want the "Abstract Test Case" pattern. Start here:

http://c2.com/cgi/wiki?AbstractTestCases

The basic pattern is this:

abstract class IFTest extends TestCase {
test1() {
IF theIf = createIF();
// Call methods
// Make assertions
}
...
abstract IF createIF();
}

class ATest extends IFTest {
IF createIF() {
return new A();
}
}

class BTest extends IFTest {
IF createIF() {
return new B();
}
}

Now run tests ATest and BTest in your test suite. Each inherits its test
methods from IFTest, so they run the same tests. ATest tests with A objects
and BTest tests with B objects. Do *not* add IFTest to your test suite.
